It's over, completely over and this movie really let's you know it's over.

Thank you James Gunn for delivering this masterpiece swansong. Thank you for saving MCU. I was a sobbing mess watching Rocket's backstory. The rendering was heartfelt, gut punching and beautiful and elegant. I hugged my rescue cats a little tighter when I got home after watching GOTG3. The movie has become the BEST Marvel CBM in my book. The cast gave their best to play their assigned roles and their chemistry on screen is almost palpable.

It's a 1000/10 for me.

The musical score and the soundtrack are absolutely amazing! I can't find better superlatives to herald how good GOTG3 is.

Rocket is the heart and soul of this film. It was actually the clip of him and his friends in a cage that moved me to go to the movie house once again after more than three years. That clip with Lylla, Teefs and Flor had me weeping. The last time I went out to watch a movie as in Jan 2020, I watched Starwars the Rise of Skywalker.

89P13 is forever etched in my heart and in my mind. I have watched GOTG3 plenty enough to have memorised Rocket's batch number.

Thank you James Gunn for saving Marvel. Thank you for taking good care of Superman. I believe that Superman is in very capable hands.

Exquisite. Loved the storyline and i adored the fact that we found out a lot of rocket's backstory, in an entertaining and fascinating way of setting the plotline. Especially since rocket is one of my favorites from the guardians. And his backstory is incredible. Me and my boyfriend were talking earlier today how some filmworks drifted away from the main plot of the story, like transformers or fast and furious (haven't seen all the movies to any but no shade), and I love how guardians of the galaxy v3 made it about rocket BUT also kept it about the guardians of the galaxy themselves and amplified traits and revealed even more about the rest of the characters, all in a perfectly linked combination. This movie made everyone in the cinema laugh for a second then have their heart clenched in the next one and then laugh at some funny phase again. It's a masterpiece and definitely worth watching.

Wow, what a movie. They really did well with this one, extremely well put together and worth the watch. My only complaint was how many times it kept hitting the heart strings, very emotional film. But also fantastic in every way. It's been awhile since they made an MCU that hits hard on the heart strings, Endgame was the last film that really pulled out the emotions for me. But this one was above and beyond in that department. They balanced it out beautifully with a lot of jokes and great action. I really liked the new characters that were brought in and the story was excellent all around. This one is 100% worth the watch.

The last James Gunn directed installment of our favorite intergalactic misfits currently in theaters. After being attacked on their home base by one Adam Warlock, Will Poulter, Rocket Raccoon finds himself mortally hurt which prompts the rest of his comrades to find a means of getting him healed (when they discover his DNA has a lock on it which if tampered with can kill him). Primarily using Rocket's backstory to tell our main narrative, we learn the evil machinations of the High Evolutionary, played by Chudwudi Iwuji, who succeeded (if success is a barometer when an animal is given humanistic traits!) w/Rocket where his other creations haven't quite landed. Throughout a series of increasing bizarre adventures on different locations, the audience is in constant state of having lumps in their throats not knowing if one of their faves will bite the dust but Gunn is shrewd enough to know which buttons to press making this an immensely satisfying time at the cinema checking off all the relevant boxes.

Finally after a couple of years loosing faith in the MCU this film saves the day! An exciting, action packed, emotional rollercoaster filled with great music (as always with the guardians) and awesome jokes. The characters just shine and draw you into their story, and the addition of Will Paulter as Adam Warlock was a stroke of genius. Drax is again my favourite but that's because I can't stop laughing at the guy all the time!!

If this is the last we see of some of the crew it was a hell of a ride and a pleasure to ride along.

James Gunn you've done it again.

Marvel have lost their most dynamic writer/director who always delivers.

DC you are very lucky.

Probably one of the best 3rd parts of a trilogy I've seen and definitely one the best superhero ones . Lt's a perfect farewell to the fun bunch that we all love .. I cried a decent amount of tears when we had to say bye to them as a whole , I'm sure we will see them in different movies but not as a team which is sad but it's better to stop while people still care ! The movie has amazing visuals if there is something Guardins movies are the best in are AWESOME looking creatures , AWESOME colors ,AWESOME music and AWESOME jokes and Vol.3 has a lot of everything ! It was very well paced and I was engaged the whole time even though I was sick and felt that 3D even worse still I didn't wanna blink for a second so I don't miss a thing .

Before I saw it I actually did read a few articles about the movie and I read that many parents were actually mad because the movie made their kids sad ... and you know what I'M SO GLAD !! And those parents they should be too cause at least they know their kids are not some sickos !

THANK YOU JAMES GUNN!! Thank you for sneaking such an important and powerful message in such a popular movie that will be seen by so many even if they " close their eyes " when it comes to this in normal circumstances! I cried a lot. I am a person who cannot stand such stuff and it hurts the deepest parts of my soul seeing something like this . I've chosen to live the way I live because if there is one thing I believe in is equally but I know how many people out there change the subject really fast when it comes to that because deep down they know its not right but it's just easier to do nothing !!! I'm happy kids saw that !! I hope they ask questions after the movie and remember how they felt while seeing these scenes ! I don't see why would someone feel offended when this is the miserable reality and if someone's mind should be changed that's exactly the kids !

Will I rewatch- YES DEFINITELY WILL , will it go to my collection- YES definitely will !

Peter Quill is just the total opposite of his original character in the previous movies.

How to apply 2020's hollywood propagada ?

Simplest and laziest way : Just swap male and female's real temper and everyday reality !

Social medias, mainstream medias and US film industry are picturing a world that justr doesn't exist.

This movie is just painfull to watch.

Anyway, as we can see for now 1,5 years, more and more movies are just becoming money pits : people just don't waste their money anymore to face a total brainwash attempt from the producers who also own mainy mainstream medias + social ones.

I have to admit that recent films left me feeling somewhat disheartened. However, "Guardians of the Galaxy 3" swooped in to rekindle my happiness and restore my faith in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. I went into the theater with tempered expectations, but I emerged with a renewed sense of joy and anticipation.

From the opening scene to the final moments, "Guardians of the Galaxy 3" captivated me with its perfect blend of humor, action, and heartfelt emotion. The film not only lived up to its predecessors but also stood out as one of the best entries in the Guardians franchise.

The movie takes viewers on an exhilarating and emotional journey that reminds us why we fell in love with these misfit heroes in the first place. The chemistry among the cast is electric, and the performances are top-notch, effortlessly blending comedy and genuine depth of character.

Director James Gunn's masterful storytelling shines through in this installment, as he skillfully balances the various plotlines, character arcs, and breathtaking action sequences. Gunn's creative vision for the Guardians universe is undeniable, and he has once again delivered a stellar cinematic experience that resonates with audiences.

One aspect that cannot be overlooked is the exceptional soundtrack. The carefully selected songs not only enhance the storytelling but also evoke a sense of nostalgia and emotion. After leaving the theater, I found myself playing the Guardians' OST on repeat, reliving the moments and feeling a surge of emotions all over again.

James Gunn's impressive directorial skills have garnered him well-deserved recognition, and it's thrilling to see him taking on new projects, including his upcoming work in the DC universe. With his proven ability to create memorable characters and weave engaging narratives, I can't wait to see what he brings to the table in future DC movies.

"Guardians of the Galaxy 3" is a testament to the power of storytelling, the strength of characters, and the magic of the Marvel Universe. It brings back the joy and excitement that initially drew us to these beloved characters, and it leaves us eagerly anticipating what lies ahead. This film is a must-watch for Marvel fans and anyone in need of a heartwarming and action-packed adventure.

Definitely tugs at the heartstrings. Loved to see a Rocket-centric movie.

Rocket has become my favorite Guardian after this movie. I have great respect for anyone that values all life (higher and lower, human and animals alike). Never abandon your friends. Especially don't abandon the furry ones that can't always fend for themselves.

It brought up emotions in me that have been spilling over since the war in Ukraine started: a need for righteous justice & revenge against a an evil overlord hellbent on exterminating you and your loved ones.

Good length. One of Marvel's best & most balanced films!

Be sure to watch the Disney+ Christmas special (with Kevin Bacon) for a few Easter eggs and some added context.

Easily the best marvel movie since endgame, everything is perfect, the comedy is perfect, the action while not being as often and as good as earlier guardians movies is still very entertaining and awesome. Every single character in this movie has there own problems and every character overcomes them in very satisfying ways, the entire cast as always is super fun and entertaining to watch interacting. The villain is easily the best since Thanos with very scary traits and very easily unlikable. 10/10 marvel movie seriously so we'll made and perfect send off to James Gunn and the guardians it's a must watch, also this is the first marvel movie to have the F word in and it is used in such a funny way.

An absolute emotional rollercoaster. Arguably the best trilogy ever made?...

The storytelling was first class. The ability to create laughter, tears and a gripping story cannot be underestimated. I'm a huge fan of the first two movies and was a little nervous of the often fatal, 'third film' but I'm relieved to say it was beyond anything I imagined.

This was Marvel back to their best: excellent character development, stunning visuals and a decent story to boot.

So if you're a fan of the first two, then you must see this film. And if you haven't seen the first two, go and see them first.

Bravo to everyone involved.

What a disappointing film. In two moments I was about to get up from the theater and leave. It had been a long time since I had seen such a pretentious film. It was a mistake to emphasize the relationships between the characters because the vast majority of them have irrational expectations and behavior; It was another mistake to put Rocket's drama as a catalyst for the film because the villain depends precisely on his relationship with Rocket and that makes any sense of danger disappear. The villain is unfortunately the weakest in Marvel history and he really looks like a jester. If you expect entertainment you will find a couple of moments to laugh (thanks to Mantis) and some interesting visuals. The rest can be said to be pretentious, unbearable, tedious and generally leaves a very bitter taste in the mouth. I rarely yelled at the good guys in a movie theater, Die!! Yesterday it happened This is not the way to make a worthy or valuable film. To put it simply: it's rubbish.

The third installment of the Guardians of the Galaxy franchise does not disappoint. Director James Gunn once again delivers a hilarious and action-packed adventure that will leave fans laughing and on the edge of their seats. The chemistry among the main cast is as strong as ever, with each character given their own moment to shine.

The film's humor is one of its strongest aspects. The jokes are clever, and the delivery is spot-on. It's impossible not to laugh when watching the Guardians bicker and banter with each other. The film also doesn't shy away from emotional moments, which are handled with care and depth.

In terms of action, the film delivers some truly impressive set pieces. The special effects are top-notch, and the fight scenes are choreographed to perfection. The soundtrack is also a standout, with a mix of classic rock and pop hits that perfectly complement the film's tone and style.

Overall, Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is a worthy addition to the franchise. It's a fun and entertaining ride that will leave audiences satisfied. Whether you're a fan of the previous films or new to the series, this movie is sure to be a hit.

A great goodbye to the saga by the even greater James Gunn, everything was where it should've been put and all is well-executed.

Perfect finale, best marvel movie since the first phases, this will make you laugh, cry and much more.

Perfect photography, I won't even talk about the direction (you will see some of the most well directed fighting scenes of at least the last few years), the dynamics between the main characters are top tier and the main focus as usual (I would've loved to see this saga as standalone without MCU references, even tho they are minimal, but this is just me asking too much, Gunn handled this perfectly) and the plot, even tho very simple, is very well paced, effective and to-the-point.

Highly recommend this movie as long as the whole saga even to people who are not into cinecomics.

The first two Guardians of the Galaxy movies are incredibly good and fun, with their fun appearances in other Marvel movies, and fun holiday special. Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 (2023) was a great ending for the Guardians, and for James Gunn's last time directing for Marvel, this movie is more serious and emotional than the earlier two Guardians of the Galaxy movies, but it still has comedy like those earlier two movies.

The whole Guardians of the Galaxy team is exceptionally good; Chris Pratt as Peter Quill/Star-Lord was great when he is trying to get over the loss of Gamora and lead the team, while also having the members of the team Drax, Groot, Mantis, and Nebula played by Dave Bautista, Vin Diesel, Pom Klementieff, and Karen Gillan who are also great in the movie. Since the focus of the movie is where Rocket came from, I am going to honestly say that Bradley Cooper as Rocket was fantastic, but he needed to be in more of the movie. You would need to see Avengers: Infinity War (2018) and Avengers: Endgame (2019) to understand the return of Zoe Saldana as a different Gamora, who is particularly good not knowing about her relationship with Peter Quill or the team.

The main villain and creator of Rocket named The High Evolutionary played by Chukwudi Iwuji was a very intimidating, weird, easy to hate villain. Doing cruel experiments to animals and Rocket's friends who Rocket made when he was held captive by the villain, and killing any experiments that do not work how he wants them to. He was easy to hate, and all the flashbacks to where Rocket is from were cute and sad whenever they would appear during the movie. I liked the appearance of Adam Warlock played by Will Poulter, and I liked the look of him, but the problem is that he only shows up at random in certain scenes without a reason when I wanted more of him; the only thing I understood was that he wanted to capture Rocket because he was working for The High Evolutionary.

The action scenes are fun and cool to watch, with there being a lot of beneficial effects, and the soundtrack is great to listen to just like the other two movies. There are a lot of emotional moments that will make you tear up with a lot of brutal moments too, but there is also good comedy that works well and is funny. The ending to the movie was nice and will make you tear up; this made Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 a great send off to the team, and nice ending to the trilogy that does have some little issues, but it was entertaining to watch.

Before watching this, I read/heard alot of folks saying it was the best MCU movie in years. That it is. But I think that understates how good it is. This MIGHT well be the best MCU move...EVER.

Now, that's a high bar, IMO. And it's difficult to compare because GG3 is a different KIND of MCU movie. GG1 and 2 were the quintissential MCU movies. Funny to the max. Action packed spectacles with heart and character thrown in. GG3 dials the humor and even action WAY back, and hits you with the feels, something few MCU movies do at all...and none do so as powerfully as this one.

This movie is effectively a story about Rocket's backstory. And warning time - it's dark. Dark enough that I think you might not want to bring the little ones. Now, I am not a believer that dark==good the way the DCEU seems to believe, but the darkness is done well here and I promise you, you will choke back some tears because you feel silly crying for a CG talking animal.

Now, the movie does have a ton of action. And some of the story beats don't ALWAYS make the most sense. Like, I could definitely watch this thing and pick apart some plot holes. But the thing about making a good movie is that nitpickers like me won't bother with your plotholes. We're too busy enjoying the movie.

I don't necessarily love where all the story arcs go at the end of the movie. Peter and some of the others have direction changes that ... kind of happen too suddenly, even when I saw them coming. I definitely like the way they handled the Quill/Gamora situation. Very unconventional choice and a very good choice.

But yeah, generally - good action, good spectacle, good humor. It checks the MCU boxes. But it also is a character movie about Rocket that is just outstanding. The complaints I have are minor and didn't even bother me that much.

Starting feels slow but emotional story of rocket and his friends is heart wrenching .I was gonna cry.

Action is pretty. Songs should be better its songs destroyed feel of moments.

Peter quills character feels little unworthy until new gamora come back.

Drax comedy is top notch you will be definitely happy at every moment.

Nebula is always a good caretaker for team and her serious role continues

Villan background story should be added , some scenes are dropped so the sequence sometimes mismatched.

But the groot finally says other than i am groot ...

Must watch movie. And also kerala story.

It's been sometime since marvel put up a movie that hits every part. James gunn does it again with this. Absolutely loved it. It's fun, emotional and gives us the ending that the Guardians of the galaxy deserves. The cast was amazing! If you're a marvel fan it will have you on the edge of your seat and with tears. From the beginning to the end of the movie there wasn't a scene where you'd be bored. Since No way home until now this was one of the best Marvel movies that ever has been out.

"In the meantime" by spacehog was the ideal song choice for the Guardians of the galaxy Vol 3. You need to watch this movie now!

Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is a poorly paced and consequently messy film with a cheap and outdated driving plot. I jumped in having no expectations and still, compared to the previous films, thought of it as mediocre at best. Allow me to address how much I adore the previous two films. For personal reasons they hold a very special place in my heart regardless, they are fantastic films. Unfortunately, this film felt like it was trying to cram in too many plot points at a time, not allowing the viewer to breath or comprehend what they had witnessed/heard seconds before. It did not feel as polished (likely due to COVID restrictions), nor did it feel crafted with the same love, care and passion as the previous two. And with this being the "final film" for this franchise, I cannot say it was a satisfying ending. This films villain, played by the brilliant Chukwudi Iwuji, was very forgettable. I can't recall he was even given a name. His cruelty and harshness came off as very forced making it difficult to see him as a real threat. I also picked out a bit more than just a handful of editing/continuity errors (which often times I can overlook) but it was honestly quite annoying. Many of the comedy bits were either not funny or cringe inducing. I will say this film does have its moments, but the positives just weren't enough to outweigh the negatives. I will end this review by stating that this is far from the worst MCU film, and can safely say the best MCU film since Spider-Man: No Way Home.

The quirky, entertaining, and distinctive Guardians series has always been a fun watch for me. As the MCU was only producing mediocre films throughout its last phase, I went to the theatre with very little hope.

Although the characters are far from ideal, they make every effort to do what is right.

What makes this movie so unique is how all of the main characters are willing to give their lives for one another when necessary, despite their incessant verbal sparring and attempt to show others that how wrong they are.

Every character received adequate screen time, which led to improved character and relationship development. Writer/director "James Gunn" did an excellent job with the screenplay. We are able to comprehend the reasoning behind Villain's actions and those of his accomplice.

The choice of vibrant, colourful attire and bizarre set design fits this universe so perfectly. I never enjoy seeing too much CGI used to create worlds, but I was pleasantly surprised by how stunning, distinct, imaginative, and immersive the entire universe is.

What a great soundtrack and background music for various scenes, it emotionally draws the spectator in.

Excellent action set pieces. Particularly the fight scene in the hallway, which was shot in a single extended take, is one of the most intriguing long shots I've ever seen. It features beautiful camera movements that give the impression that you're in the middle of the action.

The thing that stands out to me is how, from a writing perspective, they are able to inject humor into chaotic situations and emotionally taxing passages. When humor and humorous dialogue produce moving moments, it is just gold.

And the main character "Rocket Raccoon" will make you cry with his past with the other subjects of batch 89. And then you get to understand why he is the way he is in current time.

Movie could have been little shorter as some scenes were stretched a little and missed the mark. The screenplay doesn't do "Adam Warlock" justice as "the perfect cosmic being" that he is, and if he had been developed more, his final moment may have had greater emotional impact.

It's a fun and emotional ride you need to take.

I rarely post any kind of reviews, anywhere. Maybe its a fact tha latest MCU movies were kinda crap to mediocre, some of them maybe even good-ish.

This is a great movie, not only for marvel fans like me (well, it helps to know the backround a little).

Fun, many one-liners, great action, and a oh boy... makes it even stranger to write it but some scenes are "wright in the feelings".

If you have the oppurtunity to watch in on cinema, do not pass it by, waiting Disney+. Its worth it.

Rated 8/10 because I would have given a 9/10 to Endgame - best marvel movie so far. Though, I am a marvel geek, my objectivity is not as objective as it should be.

All and all, a great movie with an even greater soundtrack.

Guardians is the strongest most consistent trilogy of the MCU, with ratings of 9, 9 & 8. It had the potential to match the original Star Wars trilogy for absolute quality but slightly fumbled the ball at vol. 3.

The Rick & Morty-style sci-fi that we had hints of in the first two are given full bloom in the third film. Not a negative, necessarily: that style of humour and irreverent science fiction is very fun to watch. But that means we also don't go deep into a sense of high-stakes threat or intriguing mystery (something which Infinity War did so well). While I appreciated Rocket's backstory, and his friends' attempts to save him, this story didn't fire the imagination like the first two Guardians movies did. The plot's developments were also more predictable than the first two: a few times I correctly guessed the next scene...

Vol. 3 generally felt a bit more kids-friendly, what with all the animals, cute aliens and children (indeed, Return of the Jedi did something similar by introducing Ewoks and going overboard with puppet-aliens...a now oft-criticised move).

The cast are all on top form, as always. Tho' it's frustrating from a viewer perspective that this Gamora has to reset her relationships with everyone...it was however as neatly done as can be expected. The antagonist is played expertly by Chukwudi, but his performance can't quite save the not-credible character of the High Evolutionary, a clumsily-scripted and underwhelmingly-directed Big Bad. Ego, and even Ronan, were a bit more compelling overall.

The music, such an addictively-strong part of the first two films, doesn't quite hit the same way. Song choices seem uninspired, the production (the sound) of said songs clashes with what's on screen, rather than complements...

...as a certain character mused, the soundtrack sorely needed some King Crimson, specifically Belew-era. That bit of edge, a bit of that experimental avant-garde; while still sounding pop, fresh & mainstream. Come to think of it, the story could've done with a bit of King Crimson too.

If my review sounds a little harsh, it's only because after two strong 9/10's, and being aware of rave reviews for the third one, I was expecting something really epic. Vol. 3 still deserves the 8/10 as despite going the easy route and going 'for the feels', those feels worked...even if they were predictable. The jokes landed fine, a couple genuinely laugh-out-loud funny! There's some outstanding action & FX (one single-take battle scene near the end is particularly noteworthy). The whole package is very fine fun entertainment, a worthy end to the trilogy as long as expectations are dialled down a little...

...it's just not quite as good as the first two.

I saw this at IMAX Melbourne in 3D. It was expensive but a nice experience. The 3D movies of the modern age are a joy to behold. There are like layers of depth where things appear closer or more distant. This movie is all about Rocket in short. It's a lovely story that would be equally at home with children as well as adults. I really liked the first Guardians of the Galaxy. I have always thought the series is a more special set of movies unlike other Marvel Studios offerings. They're very entertaining. Spoiler: WE see Rockets' origin story in this film. And it's a heartwarming tale. You get your monies worth as it goes for about 2 1/2 hours and it's a fun ride. REcommended to fans of Marvel and fans of the Guardians.

I just watched GOG 3 and is a movie with nothing more than bad CGI. The plot, the script is very poor, it feels forced. I mean they wanted to make Rocket the center and the heart of the movie, but one thing is to actually accomplish that through a well writing script and a complete different thing is to use the sentence "you are the center of the story." I believe this type of movies are getting to the point in which the writers do not care about a good and deep dialogs and rather than that they only care of stupid jokes and silly acting. I feel sorry for the DC and WB movies in the hands of Gunn.

Yes James Gunn had disappointed us about DC disision but when comes to direction of movie, he has never disappointed us. And lots of insatiable movie of Marvel studios, this movie is gonna be a saving movie for it.

What good movie required, a proper script, casting and direction. Yes this movie has satisfied in that category. Story directly comes to point with no time. And it's add special moments such as showing favourite Rocket back story and that had made me emotional about how it was presented to us. This movie more goosebumps scenes compared last volume.

Villain casting was great with good screen play and character build up but time we see in screen is less. VFX And CGI was great and satisfying. Action scenes awesome and try watch it big screen. Loving things about this movie make great adding classic old pop songs, James Gunn things Coming to conclusions, yes this movie awesome and you should check out after first two parts and some basic idea what has happened in Avengers endgame and mostly it's holiday special one.

Honestly, I think that this will be the last good MCU movie. Funny story is that this was the first MCU movie I saw.

Who would have though that after so many fails, Marvel finally decided to put EFFORT in their film.

Then, they followed it up with The Marvels, but let's not get sidetracked, this review is about GotG Vol. 3.

So, this movie still has the charm of the first 2 films and the characters are all funny and act like they're supposed to. There's no female character that upstages the hero at every given moment (looking at you, Star Wars) and the plot and premise are both equally great.

Every character works of each other. For example, Rocket and Peter.

This movie will make you both laugh and cry. But don't get your hopes up for the rest of the MCU films...

9/10.

BETTER than endgame. Perfect ending to the guardians story. Unfortunately probably the end of marvel movies as well because they can't top that.

Every emotion is touched in this film from beginning to end. The deep dive into Rocket is something we haven't seen in your typical marvel movie. You couldn't have ever imagined his back story as you have to watch to fully understand his character from the past movies. This movie also has, in my opinion, the best soundtrack from the rest. It also has probably the best action scene towards the end with the best triumph as well. The only reason this movies isn't a 10/10 is because it was too short and I didn't want to leave the theater!!

I cried at the trailer, so knew a packet of tissues was in order for the final instalment of the best holy trilogy ever produced by Marvel!!! (Deadpool and Suicide Squad 🙏 roll on 2024!)

For this momentous chapter we decided to pull out all the stops, so booked 4X 3D tickets, buckled and enjoyed the ride.

All ends were tied and there was nothing 'predictable' in this finale, which meant it played out as fresh as the first time we watched volume one.

I've never waited with anticipation and excitement for so long ! It did not disappoint!!

Hail James Gunn and long may you continue to work your magic and keep us all entertained in our alternative realities for many years to come xxx.

To say it upfront, I'm not the biggest MCU Fan but that's the reason why I loved this movie or in general the trilogy so much. It doesn't feel like the MCU. Some things can be difficult to understand without the MCU knowledge but in general could the trilogy be outside of the MCU, so definitely a recommendation for aswell non-MCU Fans.

Some pros for the movie: It's hilarious - I've never laughed so much in a movie like in this one. Overall I really like the humor in these movies. Another thing what works really well is how the action scenes are choreographed. It's stunning to watch. Another thing the movie makes completely right is the way how it staged to bring this dramatic and sadish flavour to the movie.

On the contra side aren't that much things to mention except for one story arc you will see. Without spoiler I think it's way too easy written. Like in a child movie where everything works just out. But to be honest is that all I can complain about actually.

So I will definitely recommend the movie to everyone who likes science fiction. Even if you don't like the MCU (like me) it's amazing to watch such a movie.

Great movie that pulls you in and keeps you on the edge of your seat. It surprisingly tugs at the heart strings and leaves you wanting for more. It feels the gap of some backstories of the primary characters while at the same time leaves you looking to their future storylines.

The "No Sleep Till Brooklyn" scene was epic. Beastie Boys playing while the Guardians do some work.

There is a great mix of humor, intrigue, drama, action suspense and love in this movie. It leaves you wanting for more, wanting to know what happens to everyone and how they get on. James Gunn absolutely did an amazing job. Love the move and recommend it to all.

There is a lot of action, and there is a lot of killing. There is a lot of casual cursing-the kind of cursing that someone who curses a lot curses like. There are quite a lot of scenes that caused me, as an adult, emotional distress. I cried a lot during this movie. This is a very good movie that I would not bring a kid to see. I would probably bring a kid to see Fast X before this movie. That said, I saw this in IMAX and it's the best makeup, costumes, DP work, CGI work etc that I've seen in a movie so far. The action scenes are very very good because of the DP work. For the bad... There was just too much music used. I can't even remember what songs were in this movie, and I saw the movie last night. However, I can remember the songs in the first GOTG. Some of the story just didn't make sense or seemed unnecessary to me. Like the ending. Subjectively, I just don't like the ending. It doesn't make sense considering the plot of the movie. There seemed to be a lot of stream of thought adlibbing or dialogue that just seemed like ADHD bouncy braining of a script writer, which I didn't care for since I personally deal with it in daily life. I don't like what they did with Groot's dialogue. Overall, Rocket stole the show as usual. Love him. I'm glad I saw this in theater-specifically IMAX. It was definitely made for it.

It's very surprising that in the current phase of the MCU there is a good movie, especially at the best level. The closing of the arc for the guardians is an entertaining cinematic piece, full of action, comedy and with a great emotional charge.

The best lesson Marvel can take from this movie is to trust its directors more and give them free rein to do what they do best from the basic guidelines of Feige's plans.

In GotG3, the freedom that was given to James Gunn is very noticeable, since this film has many similarities with Suicide Squad. The vulgar humor, the explicit battles, the visceral forms, and the extreme emotion. The characters are at the maximum of their abilities, displaying an action show worthy of the best years of the MCU.

The directorial work stands out, with the use of unconventional lenses, the dizzying sequence shots of action scenes, the soundtrack full of rock hits from past decades and the visual effects, which this time are at their highest level, making us forget resounding failures in this regard, as in She-Hulk and Quantumania.

Perhaps the most reprehensible thing is that there are certain details that aren't very neat in editing, revealing a crude process of cutting and eliminating scenes, to prevent the film from being even longer.

The third and final part of James Gunn's work at Marvel is better than its two predecessors, envisioning a successful path for the future DCU.

An excellent way to conclude 'Guardians of the Galaxy'.

'Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3' is my favourite of the trilogy, it's easily top ten from the MCU as a whole too. There's a ridiculous amount of heart placed in throughout, none more so than with a certain Rocket Racoon; those early scenes are so well done visually. Plenty of seriousness doesn't stop the humour though, of which there is - as one would expect - plenty... that carrot face gag actually got me most.

The cast/characters are such a ragtag team, on paper I don't actually think they all fit together perfectly but in actuality it is a great bunch to follow. As for newcomers elsewhere in the film, Chukwudi Iwuji puts in a strong showing; I enjoyed him in 'Peacemaker' so good to see him further here.

All round, a thoroughly entertaining movie and a fitting wrap up... to this set of Guardians, at least.

What happened. Absolutely loved the first two Guardians films. They had the feeling that they were all a family with some great humour entwined. This was like watching a horror movie. I had my eyes shut through a lot of it. I don't like animal experiments at the best of times. I know it was Rockets story but did they have to make it so horrendous. It was mainly loud explosions and the characters shouting at each other. They kicked the whatever out of the mixed tape and music. What made it worse was our Odean cinema had the sound way too loud my ears were ringing afterwards. The other two movies had me laughing, crying and wanting more. This one I wanted to walk out of half way through. It seems to have become like a lot of the other Marvel movies. Just action and adrenaline and not much else.

Rocket Raccoon steals the show once again in Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3, which is an absolutely fantastic movie from start to finish! From the engaging storyline to the incredible action sequences, this film has it all. Director James Gunn has crafted a masterpiece that perfectly balances humor, heart, and epic adventure. The movie's pacing keeps you on the edge of your seat, while the visually stunning scenes transport you to the far reaches of the universe. With its charismatic characters, including the scene-stealing Rocket, Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is an absolute delight that will leave you with a smile on your face long after the credits roll. Don't miss out on this charming and thrilling cosmic adventure!

I went into this film with really low expectations since the last couple of movies films have been more than forgettable but this movie was something incredibly different, James Gunn was able to make a great ending for such an amazing set of characters by expanding on everything we thought we knew about them the main example would be rocket raccoon (which once again was played brilliantly by Bradley Cooper) and how the plot and the villain revolve mostly of his back story which was an incredible story to show how he became who he is all while making the audience tear up.

Chukwudi Iwuji did an incredible job of selling the threat the high evolutionary was and frankly, I found it refreshing that Marvel is doing villains who are just pure evil where I feel like in the past couple of movies they have made they have tried to make you feel empathetic for the villain wherever it's the villain trying to reconnect with their family (Doctor Strange: Multiverse of Madness) or whether they are avenging their family (Thor: Love and Thunder) so it is nice to see a villain who you can see as just pure evil and completely deranged.

Once again every member of the guardians were played so well by each actor with some old side characters such as nebula taking centre stage this time which I thought was really enjoyable and nice to see such a good character being put into the spotlight and the same with kraglin who in the past was just a background character behind yondu but now hes a full fledged character trying to prove to the team he can be useful like yondu was and the new character introduced being adam warlock (whos played by the comedic genius will poulter) was a fun and charming character my only problem with him and really the whole film is that hes called this top of the evolution chain superhuman but really throughout the film he does not do much hes just there and the only relevance he plays to the plot being at the start after that he just pops up every 20 or minutes (side note: I personally wasn't the happiest with how they used him overall as in the original comics hes this powerhouse who was used to take down thanos so to reduce him to just some little side character who doesn't show off too much power just feels like a injustice to a very important character in the marvel universe but is coming more from a comic fan then a movie critic).

Any film following a team that's directed by james gunn whether they are a group of renegade heros trying to protect the cosmos, a team of criminals sent out to be toys for the government to earn their freedom or a team of young mystery solvers, he always knows how to capture that team and/or family feeling with the bond between them all whether it's the serious moments where lives are on the line or just sitting around having a banter james knows exactly what to have them say and do to make to make them feel like they are all a real family and the same works with how he makes the films this film was such a bright and fun bit of entertainment for all the family to enjoy which knows when its time to be dumb and silly and when to be serious and it all works so well with eachother where like more recent marvel movies you could have a serious and tense scene but then all that serious feeling be taken away by a badly timed joke which hasn't landed well but that's not what happens here all the jokes and funny moment stay to their own parts to not ruin the impact the seriousness some of the moments in the film had.

He said to bung it on here - "Bog standard Marvel with some pretty decent fight bits in it' got some standing about in circles and telling someone they're alright, got a bit about someone who was a bit of a muppet who stops being a muppet, got some animals in it that are alright. That big bloke is funny. Some bits in it about a spaceship, I think there was a bit where you were thinking 'yeah, he's well dead, oh wait, for some preposterous reason that totally defies all known physics and biology, he isn't dead no more because of the power of redemption'. There's a bit with a car, then someone talks in a different language. Some other stuff happens and everyone learns something along the way.

Certainly!

Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is a fantastic addition to the popular Marvel Cinematic Universe franchise. Like its predecessors, it combines action, humor, and heart to create an unforgettable cinematic experience that will leave audiences satisfied and excited for what's to come.

One of the strengths of this film is its character development. Each member of the Guardians team is given time to shine and is given a storyline that adds depth to their already beloved personalities. Writer/Director James Gunn masterfully takes their stories in new and unexpected directions, while also managing to stay true to the characters that fans have come to know and love.

Another standout aspect of the film is its incredible soundtrack. Continuing the tradition of the previous two films, the soundtrack is packed with hits from the 80s and 90s, perfectly setting the tone for the film and adding to the overall enjoyment of the viewing experience.

Without giving away any spoilers, it's safe to say that the story is exciting, emotional, and ties up loose ends from earlier films in a satisfying way. The film also features stunning visual effects that transport audiences to different worlds and allow them to fully immerse themselves in the Guardians' adventures.

Overall, Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3 is a worthy conclusion to this beloved series and a must-see for fans of the Marvel Cinematic Universe. James Gunn has once again proven his talent for storytelling and created a film that will be remembered as a standout among the rest of the MCU.

Forget the lastest marvel films with boring stories or masculine women. The film has real stories to tell and delivers a message everybody can behind of. The storytelling is similar to the one once George Lucas did in Star Wars. I think the film deserves all the praise it gets. The soundtrack is very good, but nothing special.

What I like too is the graphics and the villain. Rocket Racoon's story is one of the missing pieces.

James Gunn will make a big hole if he leaves Disney. The film was sometimes boring at the beginning, but the buildup was perfect.

I recommend watching the chrismas special before it otherwise you won't get some details.

Very emotional, stil very light hearted, so enjoyable cinematic masterpiece. I love Gurdian of the galaxy series, it is end of one epic ride. There is no wokness , just pure Entertainment at peak. Definitely very good movie from Marvel after longtime and all credits definitely goes to James gunn. I am really excited for future of DC now. There is important for each and every character and after movie over i can remember all the characters in the movie which very good writing and true to the characters. It is really hard to make comedy movie but it is peace of cake for james gunn, peacemaker is perfect example of intelligence of gunn.

So bad and boring. Nothing but fighting and yelling and special effects and more fighting and explosions. Overdone. Incomprehensible plot. Like one big trauma-based dream. I can't believe kids are watching this. The first film was great. All the great writing and comic timing from the first film is gone. Without the romantic tension and without Rocket in full form for most of the film, it's weak. Too bad. What happened? Different writer? Different director? Whatever it is, it's too bad. Felt like it was twelve hours and then the ending was way overdone. End of the trilogy? Great. Overstayed its welcome.

GOTG3 was a near perfect film. Each main character had their time to shine and see their arc realized in a poignant way.

Gunn finds a way to make us cry, feel anger, laugh, and marvel as the best MCU Franchise comes to a close.

Through Adam Warlock and the out-of-time Gamora, we see through their eyes as they both realize how much family means to each Guardian, all who had lost nearly all the family they ever had before.

Warlock is a bit underutilized, but this was not his story to tell; it was Quill's, Drax's, Mantis's, Nebula's, Gamora's, Kraglin's, Groot's, and especially Rocket's.

I can't wait to watch it again.

Finally, marvel came to their senses. Guardians of the galaxy was once again awesome. The battle scenes and the slow motion that the director used were amazing! Almost every joke was hilarious and the actors give wonderfull performances. The villan was wonderfull and the actor is captivating, in every scene that he is in your afraid because he is powerful but also unstable. It's great that we get to see the past of a character and also see him grow through this movie. Friendly advice go watch the movie now, and bring a lot of tissues. The movie is very emotionall and has quite a few drama. In conclusion, i want to believe that the magic of marvel movies is back and this movie is the rule not the exeption.

Fantastic from start to finish! Very hard to go into any detail without spoilers but we do get Rocket's backstory and we see each of the characters find their own strengths in the most beautiful and unexpected ways.

Some are picking flaws in plot or saying too many explosions - don't listen to that. It is not meant to be a cinematic masterpiece. It does what it has always done, it brings the entertainment and it makes you feel all the feels. That is by no means a bad thing.

Immensely satisfying end to a wonderful series, I wholeheartedly admit I am not emotionally prepared to let these characters go.

TIPS

* Take snacks * Definitely have tissues * Always stay until after the credits have rolled * Have someone else who has seen it available so you can talk about how freaking awesome it was.

Generally speaking, I love this film. Comparing with other series, the guardians is alway special, full of fun. This is good watching with family members or friends. You can really enjoy the time in cinema. You may cry at the first second and laugh at the 2nd second. I am not a fan of Start lord, Groot is my favourite, the small tree cute kid, not the one here. Rocket is attracting here. I never thought he was that clear, like a genius. As the main character in this film, Rocket is the shinning star, a real one show his talent and love to all creatures. That is the key soul make gjardians to be guardian. I would like recommend this film to my friemds for Rocket.

Let's be honest, most of marvels content since Spider-Man no way home, has been pretty poor. The TV shows has been very hit and miss, majority of the movies have been lazy, and to be honest, I started to lose my patience with the franchise.

That being said, this movie is fantastic.

It's a bit slow to get going but once's it does it really is a fun ride.

My son (8 years old) loved it as did I. Well worth your time. If you haven't seen it already.

A fitting end to what has been 3 very very good additions to the Marvel universe.

I Just wish some of the other marvel movies was as good as this one.

Guardians of the Galaxy 1 was one of my favourite MCU films. It was silly, funny, but also had characters that had enough depth that you felt something. The sequel was similar but not quite as good.

Volume 3 to me was similar to 1 except we have about a decade of build up totalling 7 MCU appearances and back story galore. They feel like family to me at this point and so that's what made this farewell of a film so emotional. It has the humour we know, but depth and emotion well beyond anything I think we have seen in the MCU so far. The first official F-bomb is perfectly placed in such a casual way which makes it even more effective.

Guardians volume 3 is now one of my favourite MCU entries and I am looking forward to THE DCU with Gunn and expect Superman legacy to be amazing. Marvel over the last couple of years has been very disappointing and they have definitely dropped the ball. That's another reason why I think Guardians 3 feels so good!

This movie starts slow but like a roller coaster thus is just the climb until the bottom boost out and you go whipping down the track pushed into your seat.

If you are going to watch thus movie, watch it in the theater but bring tissues. It doesn't deliver the heart break of the Red Wedding, but it dances right up to that line.

Overall each character gets the right amount of screen time to feel like they are part of the movie rather than part of the set though Rocket plays an outsized role.

There are some nice addition to the team as well and the next Gotg will have a very good team to work with.

Excellent display of courage, friendship, compassion, humor and heroism. It's always a thrill to watch the Guardians as they journey through galaxies on their endeavor to save humanity and/or other worldly beings. There's always something new to discover.

A balanced display of all characters of Guardians of Galaxy. Every scene was captured with great exhibit of emotions by all the actors.

The movie shows a great sense of moral responsibility and also the ability to give people a chance to express goodness in the world despite their shortcomings.

The graphic and sound was epic and greatly detailed, really enjoyed the movie.

So I'll just say that I thought it was better than the first Guardians of the Galaxy but worse than the third one, and I guess I'm one of the weird people that like the second movie better than the first one. Overall, this movie's ending wasn't as emotional as I expected; the emotion is kind of spread throughout the whole movie. If you liked this movie I would also recommend Bullet Train and Dungeons and Dragons. They're both similar movies to this one: messy but extremely fun. Personally, I found D&D to be better than Guardians of the Galaxy 3, and since it's in the theaters right now I need people to watch it so I can have a sequel. All in all, Guardians of the Galaxy 3 is a fun, funny, crazy, and fitting ending to an amazing trilogy (if you've made it this far just know I'm not usually this bad at writing).

Edit: After truly loving rewatching the first Guardians, I know now that my list of this trilogy from best to worst is 2, 1, 3.

Nothing cool or original. Seems as if Gunn did this wasted and for a paycheck. What an awful way to send off a Great franchise. Leaning on all the things that made this arc cool, yet reducing it to a cheap quick payoff. No wonder Marvel is failing and this is a perfect example. What tripe.

I felt nothing from this, mote like cheated from the greatness it once was. What an utter disappointment.

There was nothing to feel here. Just like this review saying it's too short but, I have nothing more to say for this waste of space wannabe so, I have to write more when I don't want to waste anymore of my time.

Finally a good movie from MCU after a long time. To be honest I was not expecting anything from this movie after so many disappointing movies from Marvel in phase 4. But this movie is just PERFECT.

This 3rd installment is inline with the previous two parts and will not feel out of place at any point of time. Which we have earlier seen with ant-man 3.

Adam warlock is also introduced, hopefully we get to see him in future.

The movie centers around rocket and how his journey has been. It also focuses of character development of Nebula, drax and mantis. Peter and Gamora also reconnect in a way which feels natural and not forced. I am very glad that movie focuses on every character and not just romantic angle between Peter and Gamora. (I was completely expecting movie's focus to be on this, but to my surprise it was not).

The movie in a word is fun. Very enjoyable and a satisfying ending. Camera work and music are especially brilliant.

I recommend anyone who is interested to see this movie to just go and enjoy this movie in theater. Do not wait for OTT release. This movie needs to be seen on big screen and that too in 3D.

This movie provided about as good of a conclusion to the trilogy as one could ask for, taking audiences on an emotional rollercoaster ride with a fine balance between the humor we've come to expect and moments of heartfelt gravitas.

It beautifully explores themes of self-hatred, the profound significance of family bonds and ultimately self acceptance reminding us of the strength and growth that comes from embracing who we truly are.

The sound track was awesome, the characters were awesome, and the story was awesome. It's a fitting end to the trilogy and certainly one of the best MCU movies and one of the best movies this year.

I've been in a slump with super hero movies lately. I was hoping James Gunn's latest and last installment for the Guardians franchise would bring me back into the fold. It certainly did.

This movie has the gravitas lacking in so many newer Marvel films. It gives you greater emotional pull either of the first two, but still has all the heart and probably the best action sequences to boot. The fight in the hallway is particularly good!

Oh, and let's not leave out that the main villain, High Evolutionary, is one of the most developed and real villains we've had in some time. Easily the most menacing since Thanos.

In all this films gives all of our beloved Guardians their due while continuing to offer the fans something to charish for the ages. A wonderful send off.

God damn what a comeback from marvel and the mcu.

I cannot believe I am saying this but, finally in the last few years, I actually enjoyed a mcu movie since "Avengers: Endgame (2019)" with a few exceptions in between like "Spider-Man: No Way Home (2021) and "Black Panther: Wakanda Forever (2022)". Most of the movies and tv shows released in between were terrible, lacking stories and characters and were all around boring and bad.

James Gunn successfully ends the guardians of the galaxy trilogy and his journey with marvel with a gem of a movie like an icing on the cake.

This movie really brought back the original vibe and charm of the marvel movies back in the first phases without any garbage whatsoever to fit whatsoever (up to you to interpret what that means). It was coherent with the narrative and everything actually made sense.

Marvel usually overdoses in throwing in jokes and comedy whenever they can and it misses most of the time but with this movie, 95% of the jokes were hitting and I was actually cracking a smile during them even though I usually don't especially with the character of Drax. The other 5% were the Mantis jokes which FOR ME, weren't hitting MOST of the time, but in general it was all good.

All the cast were amazing no need to mention all of them everyone knows the crew at this point.

The High Evolutionary, which is the main villain which was played by Chukwudi Iwuji was very good and it shows that villains that are just filled with pure evil and nothing more while lacking motive can sometimes still be as good.

As to Adam warlock, I was very excited to see him on the big screen since I last saw him in the "marvel's guardians of the galaxy" game, and he delivered but I was bit disappointed with how much screen time he got, he got decent screen time but I just wished I've seen more with him with some more depth around him.

Marvel you've done it congratulations, THIS is how you make a movie.

P. S. "I am more a DC enjoyer".

It was a very good and emotional film. Cried. Laughed. Enjoyed every moment of the 2.5 hours of film.

The way James Gunn gives space to each of the characters (even the minor ones) is incredible. I highly recommend watching this (although 3D is not worth it as it doesn't add a lot).

I also believe there is no absolute need to watch both previous movies. There are mentions of those here as well but not enough to stop you from enjoying it. It does add to the emotional background (which helped to why I couldn't stop crying towards the end of film).

The highlight however is definitely the music. Each and every song is uniquely chosen and used.

9 stars. And if you are like me bring lots of tissues. It is indeed the end of an era.

Though not nearly the best of the three guardian films, quite honestly the least of my favorites, relatively speaking compared to the last 4-5 years of MCU films, this movie is on the better side, No Way Home not withstanding. Disney's track record of taking a franchise and running it into the ground with politics and agendas took a small break here with the only obvious attempts at inserting their political will as they attempted to make Nebula gender nonbinary, hiding the natural beauty of Karen Gillian with costuming and weird poses (see poster).

All, in all, I was provided a free screening so at least I did not have to pay for this movie, as I would be one I would wait for to come out in the $4.99 bargain rate on iTunes or Amazon Prime. Unlike most of what Disney has produced the past 6 or 7 years, this one is at least worth the five bucks.

"We'll all fly away together, one last time, into the forever, and beautiful sky" Well, GOTG 3 is a great movie in my opinion, It's worth the wait to see it at the cinema, It gives a very good movie experience for me, And as you know, this movie is the final installment in the guardians of the galaxy trilogy and it's a more serious film than the previous two, but still with the guardians concept and some humor that fit in the movie. Their final battle was epic and amazing, Adam Warlock is charming and majestic, and having a character like High Evolution as the villain gives a glimpse into Rocket's dark back story and friendship. It made me very sad at that moment and the awesome soundtrack it really engrossed me in. And the wonderful ending including 2 post credits and end credits really touched my heart, And I have to say that I love this movie and this trilogy so much.

Marvel Cinematic Universe never seems to disappoint, there are very few that will make you bored, but when it comes to their A class presentation, it is just brilliant.

Good story line, good action choreography, but there were some beautiful touchy scenes, that is bound to make you emotional, watch it, otherwise you will feel the scene if you know it in advance.

Whole cast is amazing in their performance, some might say it's long but every minute worth spending and good entertainment is on for sure.

One of the favourite things with Guardians is the choice of music, it brings an extra flavour, that extra feel to the scene.

Wow, all I can say is wow. We have literally just left the cinema after watching vol 3 of everyone's favourite galaxy guardians and I could not wait to write this review.

If you're in two minds about what watch, if this film is one of the two then there's no choice it has to be this film. In fact if this film ain't one of the two you're thinking about, then this film is still the one you should choose.

The comedy in film is ever present without becoming tired or predictable. The character depth, helped by the fact it's the thirds stand alone film as well the characters appearance in other films, is perfect. You really do care and feel for all the characters. Even the bad guy has layers.

Amazing story, well directed and superbly acted.

Absolute most watch.

This movie carefully blends every element you would look for at the finale of a trilogy (plus the Christmas special). This movie also fills a void that Marvel fans have been longing for. That is a movie where you become attached to the characters and become immersed in their stories. You feel like you can connect with them and are desperately hoping for their final outcome to be a good one.

This movie is not only a farewell, but it gives us yet another great adventure with the perfect mix of comedy and seriousness blended together with a soundtrack that is fitting and absolutely spot on. This alone would be enough, but it goes even further to deliver us the background story of Rocket. It also manages to bounce between Rockets story and the present adventure seamlessly. If Rockets story doesn't put you in the feels then I don't know what will. It certainly will be difficult for some viewers to watch as James Gunn isn't one to hold back when trying to hammer home a point and Rocket's story is no exception. Some scenes are incredibly difficult to watch due to the cruelty displayed, but it is Gunn's way of acknowledging harsh realities and how brutal and tyrannical the High Evolutionary truly is.

In my view the High Evolutionary was a much more compelling villain than even Kang in Quantumania who is tagged to be the Big Bad. The High Evolutionary's appeal as a villain is a combination of a significantly better script and an absolutely fantastic performance from Chukwudi Iwuji. The rest of the Guardians also play their roles beautifully and are casted perfectly. Each of them is also provided the correct amount of screen time to tell their story as well.

I hope the other Marvel directors take note of Gunn's success as he departs for the DCU. Every Guardians of the Galaxy film has managed to develop its characters while telling a story, something sorely lacking in other recent Marvel films.

For me this is the best Marvel movie since Infinity War (which I have pegged above Endgame).

Enjoy this film as we may not get another Marvel movie of this quality for quite some time.

The movie pans out in a seemingly random fashion where you gotta think where it is leading too. Then from there on you get a picture of what's it is all about! The writer has done justice and made the movie so surreal that it triggers your imagination and also gives you the emotional connection to it. It's more of a celebration of the team and the efforts that they put in all the other three. The plot is rather simple but the characters were complex and had you thinking what's coming next. I believe this is by far better than the others just released as it hits hard into the present and as well as the future of the series. It has a great ending to it and nothing beats it better than a popcorn and a cup of soda to it ! So cheers.

Boom! I'm not convinced the MCU is back to it's top level status, but this is a top tier MCU movie. I'ts easily in the top ten territory, with some even putting it above the first Guardians movie, though personally I'm not set on that... yet.

Also, if there was ever an MCU movie that is going to produce tears, it's this one.

Probably not a secret by this point, but one of the Guardians back stories gets explored, and we get to see what they've been hiding under that mask all this time. It's an emotional gut punch to say the least.

That being said, it still had all the charm and comedy that you'd expect from a Guardians film. The music, as always was practically perfect. Alternate timeline Gamora was great.
